endpoints.title: Select Endpoints
endpoints.description: Select the endpoints you wish to monitor. Each endpoint represents a separate Portainer instance or environment.

error.404: API not found on this host.

select_items.title: Select Containers and Stacks
select_items.description: Select the containers and stacks you want to monitor. You can also choose whether to create action buttons for these devices.

perform_container_action.name: Perform Container Action
perform_container_action.description: Performs a specified action (start, stop, restart, kill) on one or more containers.

action.name: Action
action.description: The action to perform on the containers.

container_devices.name: Container Devices
container_devices.description: A list of Docker container devices to perform the action on.

perform_stack_action.name: Perform Stack Action
perform_stack_action.description: Performs a specified action (start, stop) on one or more stacks.

action.name: Action
action.description: The action to perform on the stacks.

stack_devices.name: Stack Devices
stack_devices.description: A list of Portainer stack devices to perform the action on.

missing_endpoint.title: Unavailable Portainer Endpoint
missing_endpoint.description:
The endpoint with ID {entity_id} is no longer available in Portainer. This may happen if it has been removed from your Portainer instance. You should remove the corresponding device and its entities from Home Assistant to avoid errors.

To fix this, go to the device page for this endpoint and delete it.

missing_container.title: Unavailable Portainer Container
missing_container.description:
The container {entity_name} with ID {entity_id} is no longer available in Portainer. This may happen if it has been removed from your Portainer instance. You should remove the corresponding device and its entities from Home Assistant to avoid errors.

To fix this, go to the device page for this container and delete it.

missing_stack.title: Unavailable Portainer Stack
missing_stack.description:
The stack with ID {entity_id} is no longer available in Portainer. This may happen if it has been removed from your Portainer instance. You should remove the corresponding device and its entities from Home Assistant to avoid errors.

To fix this, go to the device page for this stack and delete it.
